tools.evaluation.score

Module Contents

Functions

specific_scores(→ tuple)

Calculate evaluation scores.
tools.evaluation.score.specific_scores(y: numpy.array, y_pred: numpy.array, target: str) → tuple[source]

Calculate evaluation scores. Including ‘Accuracy’, ‘Precision’, ‘Recall’, ‘F1-score’, ‘cohen-kappa’.

Parameters:

  • y – Ground truth value in array format, 1-d array

  • y_pred – Predicted value in array format, 1-d array

  • target – Specific clsuter label.

Return type:

Score tuple of specific cluster.

Examples

>>> specific_scores(["A", "B", "C", "A", "B"], ["A", "B", "C", "B", "A"], "A")
(0.2, 0.5, 0.5, 0.5, 0.04761904761904763)
>>> specific_scores(["A", "B", "C", "A", "B"], ["B", "B", "C", "B", "A"], "A")
(0.0, 0.0, 0.0, 0, 0.08695652173913043)
